org.xflatdb.xflat.transaction

Class TransactionOptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.xflatdb.xflat.transaction.TransactionOptions

  • public class TransactionOptions
extends java.lang.Object
    An object representing the options that can be applied to a transaction.
    Note that these options may be ignored if a currently open transaction is propagated. Control this with the Propagation option.

    The TransactionOptions object is immutable; all set methods return a new instance that has the given option set.

    • Method Detail

      • getReadOnly

        public boolean getReadOnly()
        Gets whether this transaction is Read Only. A ReadOnly transaction cannot be committed. Write operations during a ReadOnly transaction throw an exception.

      • getIsolationLevel

        public Isolation getIsolationLevel()
        Gets the transaction isolation level.

      • getPropagation

        public Propagation getPropagation()

      • withReadOnly

        public TransactionOptions withReadOnly(boolean readOnly)
        Sets whether this transaction is Read Only. A ReadOnly transaction cannot be committed. Write operations during a ReadOnly transaction throw an exception.

        This method returns a new TransactionOptions object with the specified option set.

        Parameters:
        readOnly - true to set the transaction to read only mode.
        Returns:
        a new TransactionOptions object with ReadOnly == the given value.

      • withIsolationLevel

        public TransactionOptions withIsolationLevel(Isolation level)
        Sets the isolation level of this transaction. The isolation level determines how the database applies locking to the rows.

        This method returns a new TransactionOptions object with the specified option set.

        Parameters:
        level - The isolation level of the transaction.
        Returns:
        a new TransactionOptions object with IsolationLevel == the given value.

      • withPropagation

        public TransactionOptions withPropagation(Propagation propagation)
        Sets the propagation behavior to apply when opening this transaction. The propagation behavior determines how the transaction manager should react to the current transaction scope when creating this transaction.
        Parameters:
        propagation - The propagation to apply when this transaction is opened.
        Returns:
        a new TransactionOptions object with Propagation == the given value.
